meanings.definition: To surpass in fumbling or making mistakes.
meanings.sent1: She always outfumbles her brother when it comes to dropping things.
meanings.sent2: He managed to outfumble his friend in the race by tripping at the finish line.
meanings.sent3: During the talent show, Sarah tried to outfumble the other contestants by forgetting her lines.
meanings.sent4: The rookie outfielder outfumbled the ball, allowing the opposing team to score.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's attempt to juggle live on stage only served to outfumble his previous blunders.

meanings.definition: To outdo in clumsiness or ineptitude.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he always manages to outfumbles his attempts at dancing.
meanings.sent2: She tends to outfumble her words when she gets nervous during presentations.
meanings.sent3: The magician's rabbit tried to outfumble him by escaping from the hat before the trick was done.
meanings.sent4: The new employee managed to outfumble even the most experienced workers with his constant mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter continued to outfumble his coworkers by dropping trays of food left and right.
